intro: Racosperma brockii, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by native animals. It is typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Racosperma brockii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
